description: The iMAP sends the heartbeat notification trap to the NMS
regularly each period. If the NMS receives the trap, the
connection between the NMS and the iMAP works. If not,
the connection fails.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatNotificationType I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatSystemLabel s EXAMPLE I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatPeriod i 9999 I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatTimeStamp s EXAMPLE

description: Managed system ID: indicates the managed system from which the heartbeat notification is reported.
It uniquely identifies one EMS.
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatSystemLabel

description: Heartbeat period (must be between 3 and 300), in seconds
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatPeriod

description: Time stamp: the time when the heartbeat notification is generated
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundHeartbeatTimeStamp

description: The iMAP system sends real-time alarms to the NMS using this trap.
If an alarm occurs to an NE or the iMAP, the iMAP sends the alarm
trap to the NMS.

Summary.eval: ($v11==6) ? 'IMAP northbound fault alarm ($v9) cleared' : 'IMAP northbound fault alarm ($v9) occured due to $v30'

description: Serial number of the alarm > 0.
An alarm is identified by a unique number.
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCSN

description: Category can be one of the following:
1 - Fault
2 - Clear
3 - Event
4 - Acknowledge
5 - Unacknowledge
9 - Change
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmCategory

description: Fault occurrence time, time at which the alarm has been raised
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmOccurTime

description: Managed object name for which the alarm has been generated
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmMOName

description: Product type ID:
1 - transmission
2 - mobile
3 - fixed network narrowband
4 - fixed network broadband
5 - intelligent network
6 - omc
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmProductID

description: Network Element Type ID
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmNEType

description: Network Element ID or Device ID

description: Alarm ID of the generated alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmID

description: Alarm type. It can be one of the following:

2 - Environment System
3 - Signaling System
4 - Trunk System
5 - Hardware System
6 - Software System
7 - Running System
8 - Communication System
9 - QoS
10 - Processing error
11 - OMC

description: Level is the alarm severity. It can be one of the following:

2 - Major
3 - Minor
4 - Warning
6 - Cleared

description: Alarm clear status
1 - Cleared

variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmRestore

description: Alarm acknowledgement status
1 - Acknowledged
2 - Unacknowledged
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmConfirm

description: Alarm acknowledgement time

description: Alarm detailed reasons (max: 250 characters)

description: This is one of 15 extensible alarm fields to be
reported as part of alarm information. The fields
to be reported are decided by the configuration
for the SNMP agent in file snmpsvc.xml. For
string type parameters the maximum supported
length is 250 characters. If string is longer it
will be truncated to 250 characters.

description: The operator who cleared this alarm.
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearOperator

description: Additional Information regarding the alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAdditionalInfo

description: This specifies the Clear Type of alarms.
1 - Normal Clear
2 - Restore Clear
3 - Manual Clear
4 - Configure Clear
5 - Co-relation Clear
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearType

description: This specifies the Clear Category of alarms.
1 - ADAC (Automatically Detected Automcatically Cleared)
2 - ADMC (Automatically Detected Manually Cleared)
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearCategory

description: Affecting service flag for the alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmServiceAffectFlag

description: Object instance type for the raised alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmObjectInstanceType

description: The iMAP notifies the NMS of the start of the query.
After the NMS receives the active alarm query start
trap, the query starts.
The trap is triggered by NMS for alarm query.

event.Summary: IMAP northbound fault alarm query begined

description: The iMAP system sends queried alarms to the NMS using this trap.

Summary.eval: ($v11==6) ? 'System queried alarm ($v9) cleared' : 'System sent queried alarm ($v9) to the NMS'

will be truncated to 250 characters.
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmExtendProductItem15

description: The operator who cleared this alarm.
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearOperator

description: Additional Information regarding the alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmAdditionalInfo

description: Affecting service flag for the alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmServiceAffectFlag

description: This specifies the Clear Type of alarms.
1 - Normal Clear
2 - Restore Clear
3 - Manual Clear
4 - Configure Clear
5 - Co-relation Clear
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearType

description: This specifies the Clear Category of alarms.
1 - ADAC (Automatically Detected Automcatically Cleared)
2 - ADMC (Automatically Detected Manually Cleared)
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmClearCategory

description: Object instance type for the raised alarm
variables.name: I2000-V2::iMAPNorthboundAlarmObjectInstanceType

description: The iMAP notifies the NMS of the stop of the query.
After the NMS receives the active alarm query stop
trap, it indicates that the query ends.
The NMS triggers the stop of the query, or the query
ends after the NMS receives the active alarms.

event.Summary: IMAP northbound fault alarm query ended
